Description.val:
The FY 2020 funding request was reduced by $9.000 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

This funding procures long-lead major end items and sub-component kits required for repairs to both variants of Littoral Combat Ships (LCS). The items procured mitigate major long-lead replacement times due to system failures and casualties and increases availability of vital Fleet assets by reducing repair part procurement and delivery times. Funding procures support equipment, required ancillary equipment, and associated engineering and technical support services for LCS.

LN001 - LCS Battle Spares
This line procures shore-based battle spares, ensuring their availability in the event of a failure or major casualty to key ship and mission package systems. Systems that require shore-based spares include gas turbines, diesel engines and generators, propulsion systems, reduction gears, Auxiliary Propulsion Units (APUs), Machinery Plant Control & Monitoring Systems (MPCMSs), Command/Control/Communications/Computers/Collaboration/Intelligence (C5I), Combat Systems, AIS Laptops and mission package support equipment. Inventory objectives are determined by the LCS Reliability, Maintainability, and Availability (RMA) data, NAVSEA RMA guidance, the critical application of equipment, and inputs from the NAVSEA 05 technical community. The MK 110 57MM gun (BOFORS) is a multi-purpose, medium caliber gun installed on all LCS hulls. The primary mission of the MK 110 Gun Mount is to provide engagement of known surface threats during combat operations in a theater area of operation.  This system is common across both variants of LCS.

LN002 - LCS Water Jet Spares
Both LCS variants are propelled by water jets; this line procures spare water jets and water jet components.  There are two LCS variants and five water jet configurations, the FREEDOM variant and the INDEPENDENCE variant, each using four water jets. The FREEDOM variant uses Rolls-Royce water jets and the INDEPENDENCE variant uses Wartsila Lips water jets.  The water jet assemblies are mounted externally on the ships' transom. These items will be designated as battle spares material and support a rotatable pool for life cycle sustainment. In the event of a casualty the broken water jet is replaced with an operational asset from the water jet inventory pool and the non functional asset is sent to the depot to be repaired. AIS Laptops - procurement and fit LCS platforms with additional PoR AIS laptops in CIC (Freedom Variant 16 quantity/ Independence Variant 16 Quantity).

LN003 - Engineering Services
This funding provides engineering and technical support for LCS Class Support Equipment.  Services include the establishment of Technical Data Packages (TDPs) and the creation of associated depot level repair parts lists/installation requirements. Funding is also provided for Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) and Design Services Allocation (DSA) modernization efforts tied to the ship availabilities.  

LN006 - LCS Ships Class Ancillary Equipment
This funding procures the connective equipment necessary to ensure fit and function of procured LCS Class Support Equipment when installed.

LN007 - AFSB SOF MODs
This funding procures the 3-D Air Search Radar to modify the Mobile Landing Platform-Afloat Forward Staging Base (MLP-AFSB) (Expeditionary Mobile Base, ESB) to support Special Operations Forces (SOF) requirements.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 funding supports procurement of multiple LCS Battlespares:

(1) Twin-Boom extensible crane (Independence variant), (1)) Star Safire III, (1) MK 110 57MM gun, (1) TRS 4D Radar (partial kit, Freedom variant) and (2) boat davits (Freedom and Independence variants).

The MK 110 57MM gun is classified as a single point of failure (SPF) component for LCS, as it has no redundancy and a failure of the gun is a mission ending event. Based on failure analysis/rates on LCS (from April 2014 through December 2018), there have been multiple critical / non-critical failures identified across 7 hulls. Due to mission criticality and the fact that this system is common across both variants of LCS, the technical community has recommended a complete Battle Spare procurement to support the mission.

AIS Laptops - procurement and fit LCS platforms with additional PoR AIS laptops in CIC (Freedom Variant 2 quantity/ Independence Variant 2 Quantity) $350K
